sentence.text: Sonic hedgehog (positive regulation of cell proliferation) signaling is an important promotor of desmoplasia, a critical feature in pancreatic cancer stromal reactions involving the activation of pancreatic stellate cells (PSCs).
The present study investigated the association between Gremlin 1 and positive regulation of cell proliferation, and the effect of Gremlin 1 in pancreatic cancer.

Primary human PSCs and pancreatic cancer cell lines were exposed to positive regulation of cell proliferation, cyclopamine, osteoblast differentiation family zinc finger-1 (osteoblast differentiation-1) small interfering RNA (siRNA), and Gremlin 1 siRNA to examine their associations and effects using an MTT assay, reverse transcription-quantitative polymerase chain reaction analysis, western blot analysis, and migration or invasion assays.

In a screen of pancreatic cancer cell lines, AsPC-1 and BxPC-3 cells expressed high levels of Gremlin 1, but only AsPC-1 cells exhibited a high expression level of positive regulation of cell proliferation.

Based on the data from the present study, it was concluded that an abnormal expression level of Gremlin 1 in pancreatic cancer was induced by positive regulation of cell proliferation signaling, and that the overexpression of Gremlin 1 enabled pancreatic cancer progression
